description.narrative: Right of children to information and expression is progressively fulfilled and stakeholder and duty bears are increasingly aware of the situation of children and women, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Right of children to information and expression is progressively fulfilled and stakeholder and duty bears are increasingly aware of the situation of children and women

description.narrative: UNICEF drew attention to the situation of children in Burundi through publications in traditional and digital media. In 2019, 44 child journalists were trained, resulting in a strengthened child-friendly media network, with 252 articles (radio programmes, videos, blog notes, social media posts) produced by children/on children's rights. UNICEF produced 10 human interest stories, 2 photo essays and 7 videos on its advocacy and programme priorities, with an additional 25 videos produced by UNICEF implementing partners. The social media audience increased regularly with 36899 Facebook followers, 2162 Instagram followers, 79642 views on Youtube. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019
